member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults
member.summary: Helper class defining all supported keywords default values.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.AutoShrinkThreshold
member.summary: The percent of free space in the database file that is allowed before autoshrink begins. A value of 100 disables autoshrink. If not specified, the default value is 60

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.CaseSensitive
member.summary: A Boolean value that determines whether or not the database collation is case-sensitive. By default the case-sensitive flag is set to false.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.DataSource
member.summary: The file path and name of the SQL Mobile database.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.DefaultLockEscalation
member.summary: The number of locks a transaction will acquire before attempting escalation from row to page, or from page to table. If not specified, the default value is 100.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.DefaultLockTimeOut
member.summary: The default number of milliseconds that a transaction will wait for a lock. If not specified, the default value is 2000.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.Encrypt
member.summary: A Boolean value that determines whether or not the database is encrypted. Must be set to true to enable encryption or false for no encryption. If not specified, the default value is false.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.EncryptionMode
member.summary: Encryption mode with which the database is to be created against.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.Enlist
member.summary: By default, enlist value is false. This can be set to true. If a connection database is opened by using Enlist set to true, the connection is promoted to a transaction.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.FileMode
member.summary: The mode to use when opening the database file.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.FlushInterval
member.summary: Specified the interval time (in seconds) before all committed transactions are flushed to disk. If not specified, the default value is 10.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.Lcid
member.summary: The locale ID (LCID) to use with the database.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: The largest amount of memory, in kilobytes, that SQL Server Mobile can use before it starts flushing changes to disk. If not specified, the default value is 640.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.MaxDatabaseSize
member.summary: The maximum size of the database, in Megabytes. If not specified, the default value is 128.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.Password
member.summary: The database password, which can be up to 40 characters in length. If not specified, the default value is no password. This property is required if you enable encryption on the database. If you specify a password, encryption is automatically enabled on the database.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.PersistSecurityInfo
member.summary: When set to false (which is strongly recommended), security-sensitive information, such as the password, is not returned as part of the connection if the connection is open or has ever been in an open state. Resetting the connection string resets all connection string values, including the password. The default value is false.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.TempFileMaxSize
member.summary: The maximum size of the temporary database file, in Megabytes. If not specified, the default value is 128.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeConnectionStringDefaults.TempFilePath
member.summary: The location of the temporary database.

This method populates the parameter accessor using user specified parameter information (from SqlCeParameterCollection). Accessor information populated here is passed on to Query Processor to help it determine the parameter type information.

-------------------------------------------------------------------
This method populates the parameter accessor taking information from Query processor (QP). Accessor information here gives the parameter type info that query processor used during plan compilation.
We do not assume that parameter type information specified by user (ref method CreateAccessorFromParameterList) is same as the type information which QP finally uses to generate the plan.
This is a safe assumption for now and we should revisit whether it is needed at all in future.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaTrackOption
member.remarks: Specifies whether or not the table being pulled to the device is tracked.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaTrackOption.TrackingOff
member.summary: Indicates that SQL Server Compact Edition does not track changes to the pulled table. No PRIMARY KEY constraints are created locally.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaTrackOption.TrackingOn
member.summary: Indicates that SQL Server Compact Edition tracks all changes to the pulled table. PRIMARY KEY constraints related to the value specified for sqlSelectString are created on the local table. This is the default setting.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaTrackOption.TrackingOnWithIndexes
member.summary: Indicates that SQL Server Compact Edition tracks all changes to the pulled table. Indexes and PRIMARY KEY constraints that existed on the SQL Server table specified in sqlSelectString are created on the local table.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaTrackOption.TrackingOffWithIndexes
member.summary: Indicates that SQL Server Compact Edition does not track changes to the pulled table. Indexes and PRIMARY KEY constraints that existed on the SQL Server table specified in sqlSelectString are created on the local table.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaBatchOption
member.remarks: Specifies whether or not the rows associated with the should be batched together in a single transaction.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaBatchOption.BatchingOff
member.summary: Indicates that SQL Server Compact Edition does not batch rows pushed to SQL Server. The server processes each row separately. This is the default setting.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.RdaBatchOption.BatchingOn
member.summary: Indicates that SQL Server Compact Edition batches the rows pushed to SQL Server into a single transaction.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeRemoteDataAccess.Push(System.String,System.String)

The OLE DB connection string used when connecting to the SQL Server database.

The OLE DB connection string used when connecting to the SQL Server database.

member.name: P:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeRemoteDataAccess.CompressionLevel

member.value: The compression level to use. Valid values are 0 to 6 (inclusive), with a setting of 0 representing no compression and a setting of 6 enabling maximum compression.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.AddOption
member.remarks: Determines whether the subscription will be added to an existing database or whether a new database will be created when the subscription is added.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.AddOption.ExistingDatabase
member.summary: Adds the subscription to the existing database that defined in the connection string.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.AddOption.CreateDatabase
member.summary: Causes a new Microsoft SQL Server 2005 Compact Edition database to be created when the subscription is created.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.DropOption
member.remarks: Specifies whether to leave or delete the Microsoft SQL Server 2005 Compact Edition database when dropping a subscription using the method.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.DropOption.LeaveDatabase
member.summary: Deletes the replication system tables, all replication system columns in the user tables, and constraints when dropping a subscription using the method, but does not delete the SQL Server Compact Edition database.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.DropOption.DropDatabase
member.summary: Deletes the SQL Server Compact Edition database when dropping a subscription using the method.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.DropOption.UnregisterSubscription
member.summary: Deletes the replication system tables and all replication system columns (but not constraints) in the user tables when dropping a subscription using the method, but does not delete the SQL Server Compact Edition database.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.NetworkType

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.NetworkType.TcpIpSockets
member.summary: Use the TCP/IP Sockets Net-Library when setting the or properties of the object.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.NetworkType.MultiProtocol

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SecurityType.DBAuthentication

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SecurityType.NTAuthentication
member.summary: Use Integrated Windows Authentication when connecting to the Publisher or Distributor during Replication.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.ExchangeType
member.remarks: Specifies whether data is merged up to the Publisher only, or merge in both directions between the Publisher and the Subscriber.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.ExchangeType.None
member.summary: No specific exchange type

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.ExchangeType.Upload
member.summary: Merges only the Subscriber changes with the Publisher.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.ExchangeType.BiDirectional
member.summary: Merges all changes between the Publisher and Subscriber. This is the default setting.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.ValidateType
member.remarks: Specifies the type of data validation to perform.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.ValidateType.NoValidation
member.summary: Specifies that validation will not be performed. This is the default setting.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.ValidateType.RowCountOnly
member.summary: Specifies that a row count comparison will be performed on the published data.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SnapshotTransferType
member.remarks: Controls how snapshot files are transferred from the Distributor to the computer running IIS.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SnapshotTransferType.UNC
member.summary: The snapshot file will be transferred from the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share on the server. This is the default.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SnapshotTransferType.FTP
member.summary: The snapshot file will be transferred via the FTP protocol.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeReplication.BeginSynchronize(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts an asynchronous data synchronization operation. When synchronization ends, the delegates are called. During synchronization, no status reporting is performed.
member.returns: The interface for the asynchronous operation that has been started by calling this function. You can use this interface for testing for completion, or waiting until synchronization ends.
member.param: A user-defined object that is returned by the property.
The delegates that are implemented by the caller and called at the end of synchronization.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeReplication.BeginSynchronize(System.AsyncCallback,System.Data.SqlServerCe.OnStartTableUpload,System.Data.SqlServerCe.OnStartTableDownload,System.Data.SqlServerCe.OnSynchronization,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts an asynchronous data synchronization operation. When the synchronization ends, the delegates are called. During the synchronization, synchronization status reports are sent to the SyncStatusReport delegates.
member.returns: The interface for the asynchronous operation that has been started by calling this function. You can use this interface for testing for completion, or waiting until synchronization ends.
member.param: A user-defined delegate that consumes the ongoing synchronization events that are reported during the reconciler work.
A user-defined object that is returned by the property.
A user-defined delegate to the event that fires at the start of uploading table changes to the server.
The delegate that is implemented by the caller called at the end of synchronization.
A user-defined delegate to the event that fires at the start of downloading table changes from the server.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeReplication.EndSynchronize(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends an asynchronous data synchronization that was started by a call to the System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeReplication.BeginSynchronize method.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.SqlCeReplication.CancelSynchronize

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlServerCe.ValueMapper
member.summary: ValueMapper is used to map command parameters from what is contained in the DataSet from the server to the correct type that is stored in the client-side DB. There are complications with ADO.NET versions in that new Katmai datatypes, namely DateTimeOffset, are not available in ADO.NET 2.0 or in NETCF. They are available in ADO.NET 2.0 SP1 on desktops, so the appropriate ValueMapperDelegate to use must determined at runtime. Clients built with 2.0 that use our libs built on 2.0 SP1 must avoid trying to check for System.DateTimeOffset or else they will hit a TypeLoadException. This class is used to avoid that case by providing distinct Internal mappers that will be used correctly depending on what types are available at runtime.

member.summary: Gets the mapped value of the parameter

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.UnmanagedLibraryHelper.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to load a dll and be responible for freeing it.
member.param: full path name of dll to load
member.remarks: Throws exceptions on failure. Most common failure would be file-not-found, or that the file is not a loadable image.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.UnmanagedLibraryHelper.GetUnmanagedFunction``1(System.String)
member.summary: Dynamically lookup a function in the dll via kernel32!GetProcAddress.
member.param: Raw name of the function in the export table.
member.returns: null if function is not found. Else a delegate to the unmanaged function.
member.remarks: GetProcAddress results are valid as long as the dll is not yet unloaded. This is very very dangerous to use since you need to ensure that the dll is not unloaded until after you're done with any objects implemented by the dll. For example, if you get a delegate that then gets an IUnknown implemented by this dll, you can not dispose this library until that IUnknown is collected. Else, you may free the library and then the CLR may call release on that IUnknown and it will crash.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.UnmanagedLibraryHelper.Dispose
member.summary: Call FreeLibrary on the unmanaged dll. All function pointers handed out from this class become invalid after this.
member.remarks: This is very dangerous because it suddenly invalidate everything retrieved from this dll. This includes any functions handed out via GetProcAddress, and potentially any objects returned from those functions (which may have an implemention in the dll).

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.KillBitHelper.GetKillBit
member.summary: Gets the kill bit value from the registry varibles. This function checks if any of the versions above the current version is killbitted. If yes then this return true indicating there is a pottential security vunrability hence does not allow to use this assembly else it return false indicating it is safe to use this assembly.

member.summary: Releases all objects associated with the accessor.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the Accessor class and optionally releases the managed resources.
true to release managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:System.Data.SqlServerCe.Accessor.ReleaseNativeInterfaces
member.summary: Releases the native interfaces. Note that this API gets called even from the Finalize() and we should make sure that we don't run into AVs and DllNotFound Exceptions.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Allocated proper data buffer based on the information in binding arr.

-------------------------------------------------------------------
The size of the data buffer (for one set of values). Data binding array describes layout of a set of values. This accessor may contain a number of sets mapped by one binding array.

-------------------------------------------------------------------
This returns the actual buffer size which is a multiple of the size returned by DataBufferSize.
